column4: i have checked google and the forums and can't find anything related to my sound warning, i would really like some help with it.
thanks i am checking into that right now.

i was going to give you some long winded details about my situation but, although i don't fully understand them, i think this: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/9544/  will be way more comprehensive then anything i would have said!.
yep except in rhythmbox and listen music player.
are you using Software Sound Mixing (in System> Preferences> Sound) ?
all system sounds do not work. vlc, mplayer, totem and amorok all do not work
ok, start by unmuting 'Master' and muting 'IEC958'
the essential question is whether you want to use your onboard or your usb
currently the default audio device is the onboard, not the usb
i want it to be the usb
in a Terminal, execute:  asoundconf set-default-card UA25
then, log out and back in
okay i'll give that a try. see you soon!
yep that completely worked the sound is back! thanks for the help.
